meanings.definition: The ability to accomplish a task with minimal waste or effort.
meanings.sent1: Her efficiency in completing the project ahead of schedule impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The factory improved its efficiency by upgrading its machinery.
meanings.sent3: The robot's efficiency in cleaning the house left the family with nothing to do.
meanings.sent4: His efficiency in solving complex problems was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The student's efficiency in studying for exams was remarkable.

meanings.definition: The ratio of useful work performed to the total energy expended.
meanings.sent1: The car's efficiency in fuel consumption saved the driver money.
meanings.sent2: The company focused on improving the efficiency of its production line.
meanings.sent3: The efficiency of the solar panels made the house energy independent.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's efficiency in using energy during the race was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The efficiency of the new engine design amazed the engineers.

meanings.definition: The quality or degree of being efficient.
meanings.sent1: The manager praised the team for their efficiency in handling the project.
meanings.sent2: Efficiency is key in maximizing productivity in any organization.
meanings.sent3: The efficiency of the magician's tricks left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The efficiency of the new software made tasks much easier to complete.
meanings.sent5: The efficiency of the process streamlined operations and reduced costs.
